*div1 type="summary"* *p*Austin to Secretary of Relations, July 13, 1830. Colonists of Texas are loyal to Mexico. Excited by alarming rumors, but are now quieted, "Poinsett has no adherents here."*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*San Felipe de Austin,*/location_mentioned* *date_mentioned n="07-13-1830">July 13, 1830*/date_mentioned*.*/p* *p*Dear Sir:*/p*
*p*I have learned from the *location_mentioned*public prints*/location_mentioned* that various rumors have upset public opinion concerning the *location_mentioned*colonies of Texas*/location_mentioned*; rumors without the least foundation in fact, although not without a specious basis. Much injustice may sometimes proceed from a mistaken opinion concerning an individual or a *location_mentioned*community*/location_mentioned*, and I believe it is the duty of every man to contribute in so far as he is able to the correction of errors. In this opinion, and in obedience to the truth, I have believed it to be my duty to explain to you (what I have constantly manifested to the*person_mentioned* authorities of the state*/person_mentioned*) that there has never been the least disturbance of good order in this *location_mentioned*colony*/location_mentioned*, and that the *person_mentioned*inhabitants */person_mentioned*have always been obedient to the *person_mentioned*authorities*/person_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*The idea that the *person_mentioned*colonists */person_mentioned*of *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*wish to separate from *location_mentioned*Mexico*/location_mentioned* is entirely mistaken; there is not, and never has been, such an idea in the sensible part of the *person_mentioned*colonists*/person_mentioned*, because it is very evident that it is not to the interest of *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*to be separated from *location_mentioned*Mexico*/location_mentioned*, even if such a thing were possible. These *person_mentioned*colonists*/person_mentioned*. Dear Sir, are not discontented nor dissatisfied; nor have they shown [any] discontent until after the circulation here of a thousand alarming rumors con- cerning the excitement which was said to have been manifested against them in *location_mentioned*Mexico*/location_mentioned*, and until it was said that a large *person_mentioned*expedition*/person_mentioned* was coming here to destroy them. The injurious effect of such rumors has been entirely removed by the letters of his *person_mentioned*Excellency the Vice President*/person_mentioned* and of *person_mentioned*General Teran*/person_mentioned* and by the observations published in the *location_mentioned*Gazette */location_mentioned*of this day, some numbers of which I send you. The discussion in the *location_mentioned*Gazette */location_mentioned*of the *date_mentioned n="07-10-1830">10th of this month */date_mentioned*has had a decisive effect because it gives a clear explanation of the origin of all of the evil. *person_mentioned*Señor Poinsett*/person_mentioned* has no *person_mentioned*adherents */person_mentioned*here.*/p*
*p*I for my part declare to you that I have had no other rule but that of fidelity and gratitude to *location_mentioned*Mexico*/location_mentioned*: I have passed nine years in the most trying labors in the effort to reclaim this *location_mentioned*country */location_mentioned*from the *location_mentioned*wilderness*/location_mentioned*; I have fulfilled my duty to the extent of my ability; I have worked in good faith; and I can refer with confidence to all the *person_mentioned*authorities */person_mentioned*of *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*and of the state to prove my conduct from the time I first entered this *location_mentioned*wilderness */location_mentioned*in *date_mentioned n="xx-xx-1821">1821*/date_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*I can do no less than feel much interest in the fate of the *person_mentioned*colonists of *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned*. I was the cause of the emigration of most of them and we have borne years of labor together. I could do no less than feel much interest in the advancement and prosperity of *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned*, because it has been the object of my efforts and the sole aim of my ambition to contribute to the redemption of this *location_mentioned*country */location_mentioned*from the unpopulated condition in which I found it in *date_mentioned n="xx-xx-1821">1821 */date_mentioned*and make it a useful and productive part of the great *location_mentioned*Mexican republic*/location_mentioned*. I protest to your *person_mentioned*Excellency */person_mentioned*that I came to *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*with sound intentions and I have never had others. All my interest and all my *person_mentioned*family */person_mentioned*are here, and never have I spared labor in the service of this, my *location_mentioned*adopted country*/location_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*With great cost and labor I have made a map of all *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned*, which I sent to the *person_mentioned*Political Chief*/person_mentioned* in *date_mentioned n="06-xx-1829">June of last year*/date_mentioned* to be forwarded to the *person_mentioned*President*/person_mentioned*, accompanying it with some notes in order to add to the geographical knowledge of the *location_mentioned*Mexican territory*/location_mentioned*. In *date_mentioned n="03-xx-1830">March of this year */date_mentioned*I sent to your *person_mentioned*Excellency */person_mentioned*a copy of the translations which I made of the colonization laws; accompanying them with an historical sketch of my *location_mentioned*colony*/location_mentioned*. From this your *person_mentioned*Excellency */person_mentioned*can form an idea of the labors that have passed.*/p*
*p*I have entire confidence in the justice and in the talent of the present *person_mentioned*administration*/person_mentioned*; I consider it the Savior of *location_mentioned*Mexico */location_mentioned*from anarchy, and can assure your *person_mentioned*Excellency */person_mentioned*that the hope of seeing this *location_mentioned*country*/location_mentioned* happy, after the convulsions of the last two years had almost suffocated it is again revived among these *person_mentioned*colonists*/person_mentioned*. We have confidence in our old*person_mentioned* Commandant General*/person_mentioned*, our present *person_mentioned*Vice President,*/person_mentioned* and in his *person_mentioned*cabinet*/person_mentioned*; and I beg your *person_mentioned*Excellency */person_mentioned*to permit me to commend to the high consideration of the government the worthy *person_mentioned*inhabitants of *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned*, new as well as old. If suffering years of hardships in the *location_mentioned*desert */location_mentioned*and being exposed to danger from *person_mentioned*Indian */person_mentioned*bravos offer any ground for claiming the attention of the Government, surely the *person_mentioned*inhabitants */person_mentioned*of *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*deserve to be effectively protected and not to be sacrificed to rumor or to suspicions fed by party feeling or by the intrigues of a *person_mentioned*foreigner [Poinsett?]*/person_mentioned**/p* *p*With the highest consideration I am your*person_mentioned* Excellency*/person_mentioned*'s servant,*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Estevan F Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
